conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Good morning, Ms. Johnson. How have you been feeling since our last visit?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Good morning, doctor. I've noticed some improvement, but I still feel quite tired.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Have you been taking your levothyroxine and metformin as prescribed?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Yes, I have been taking them daily.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Have you noticed any change in your weight, mood, skin or hair?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: My mood has improved slightly, but I haven't noticed any significant changes in my weight or the condition of my skin and hair.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Any side effects from the medications?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: No, I haven't noticed any side effects.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: That's good to hear. Let's do a physical examination. (Doctor performs physical examination)

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Your vitals are stable, and the puffiness around your eyes has reduced. However, your skin remains dry. Let's review your blood test results. (Doctor reviews blood test results)

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Your TSH levels have decreased but are still above the normal range, indicating that your hypothyroidism is not yet fully controlled. We need to slightly increase your levothyroxine dosage.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Continue with your balanced diet and regular exercise. And, take the increased dosage of levothyroxine.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: We'll meet again in six weeks. Please continue taking the increased dosage until then.
